From the available strucutres in the pdb of each domain, the AA sequences were aligned to identify common regions.

Structures for each domain stating the domain or being used to determine the exact AA-ranges by using their sequences in seq-alignments with full nsp3 sequence:
Ubl1:	2gri, 2idy
HVR:	ranges determined by knowing Ubl1 and Mac1
Mac1:	2fav, 2acf
It is from the available data unclear, if the last 3 AA 356-358 still belong to Mac1 or if even additional AAs from the following linker belong to it.

Mac2:	6yxj
Mac3:	2jze, 2jzd, 2jzf, 2rnk, 2kqv
DPUP:	2kaf

2w2g and 2wct include the sequence of Mac2 and Mac3, also known as SUD-NM.
2kqw includes the sequence of Mac3 + DPUP.

For Mac2 and Mac3 it was unclear wether AAs 513-526 belong to Mac2-C-Term or to Mac3-N-Term, since the structures
2jze, 2jzd, 2jzf, 2rnk state both. However, 2kqv (from other authors) suggests Mac3 starting at 527, and 6yxj (from a third group of independent authors)
suggests Mac ending with AA 526 and therefore the same thing.
DPUP was determined by knowing (Ubl2+)PL2pro and some Mac3 structures. Entries 2kaf and 2kqw support this proposal, but the last 2 AAs are not included in
both structures.

PLpro:	4m0w, 5tl6, 3e9s, 4ovz, 3mj5, 5y3q, 2fe8, 4ow0, 5y3e, 5e6j, 4mm3, 5tl7
NAB:	2k87
